tool.name: imagemetadata

method.name: add
method.shortdescription: Add a key-value pair if possible.

param.name: key
param.description: The name of the FITS or other keyword.

method.description: Add a key-value pair if possible.
method.example: imd.open("myim.im") # add a keyword "test" with value "first" if add("test", "first"): print "test=first has been added" else: print "Unable to add key test" imd.done()

method.name: close
method.shortdescription: Close the image metadata tool. Synonym for done().
method.description: This function closes the image metadata tool. This means that it detaches the tool from its underlying metadata object. Methods cannot be run on it until it is opened with another or the same image.

method.name: done
method.shortdescription: Close the image metadata tool. Synonym for close().
method.description: This function closes the image metadata tool. This means that it detaches the tool from its underlying metadata object. Methods cannot be run on it until it is opened with another or the same image.

method.name: get
method.shortdescription: Get the value associated with the specified, case-insensitive FITS keyword.

param.name: key
param.description: The name of the FITS or other keyword.

method.description: Get the value associated with the specified, case-insensitive FITS keyword.

method.name: list
method.shortdescription: Get a dictionary of FITS-like header items.

param.name: verbose
param.description: If true, print listing to logger

method.description: Get a listing of traditional FITS-like "header" items.
method.example: imd.open("myim.im") mylist = imd.list(False) imd.done() crval1 = mylist{"crval1"}

method.name: open
method.shortdescription: Open this image metadata tool providing access to an image's metadata.

param.name: infile
param.description: Image name. The image can be in any \casa\ supported format.

method.description: This method creates access to the specified image's metadata.
method.example: immd.open("myim.im") # do stuff with the tool and then close it. immd.done()

method.name: remove
method.shortdescription: Remove or clear the value of a keyword if possible.

param.name: key
param.description: The name of the FITS or other keyword.

param.name: value
param.description: Value to remove if the key is multi-valued. Only used in the case of key="masks".

method.description: Remove or clear the value of a keyword if possible. If key="masks", a value specifying the mask to remove may be specified. If no value is specified, all masks are removed.
method.example: imd.open("myim.im") # clear the brightness unit if imd.remove("bunit"): print "bunit has been cleared" else: print "Unable to clear bunit" imd.done()

method.name: set
method.shortdescription: Set a keyword to the specified value if possible.

param.name: key
param.description: The name of the FITS or other keyword.

method.description: Set a key-value pair if possible.
method.example:
Note that when setting the reference value of a polarizaiton axis, one must provide an array of stokes/polarization strings (["I", "Q", "XX"]) that is the same length as the stokes axis. If the stokes axis is degenerate, one can alternatively provide a string indicating the stokes value.
imd.open("myim.im") # Set keyword "telescope" with value "Argus Array" if imd.set("telescope", "Argus Array"): print "telescope has been updated" else: print "Unable to update telescope." imd.done()
# set polarizations for an image with three pixels on the stokes axis crval3 imd.open("myim.im") if imd.set("crval3", [XY, LL, "Q"]): print "polarization values have been updated" else: print "Unable to update polarization values." imd.done()
